metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5344 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel through 4.14.13, drivers/block/loop.c mishandles lo_release serialization, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (__lock_acquire use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified other impact. 范龙飞 discovered that a race condition existed in loop block device implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5344` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-142-generic - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-lowlatency - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-3.13.0-142-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-142.191
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-142-generic - 3.13.0-142.191
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1016-aws - 4.4.0-1016.16
No subscription required
